Name: Trap Buster
Description: 33% chance to destroy a trap instead of triggering its effect. Warning, this works on tiles as well.

Name: Shell Armor
Description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

Name: United We Stand
Description: Activates all teammates's Form Changes.

Name: Precision
Description: All moves have their range doubled, except moves with a range of 1.

Name: Stimulation
Description: All stats are boosted by 1 stage when Belly is above half capacity; but it drains twice as fast.

Name: Normalize
Description: All the Pokémon's moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Name: Chaaarge!
Description: Alliances are replaced with a devastating Charge. All moves are always supereffective regardless of typing, but it consumes four times as much belly.

Name: Synced Breathing
Description: Alliances do not consume Belly.

Name: Flower Veil
Description: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.

Name: Surprise!
Description: Apricorns, gifts, and other recruiting items have 100% effectiveness on foes currently celebrating their birthday.

Name: Squad Up
Description: Apricorns, gifts, and other recruiting items thrown by the user have a 10% higher chance of recruiting Pokemon for each teammate close to the user.

Name: Flower Gift
Description: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of the Pokémon and its allies in harsh sunlight.

Name: Water Compaction
Description: Boosts the Defense stat sharply when the Pokémon is hit by a Water-type move.

Name: Stamina
Description: Boosts the Defense stat when the Pokémon is hit by an attack.

Name: Hustle
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but lowers its accuracy.

Name: Grass Pelt
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat on Grassy Terrain.

Name: Soul Heart
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat every time another Pokémon faints.

Name: Competitive
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat sharply when its stats are lowered by an opposing Pokémon.

Name: Berserk
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to drop to half or less.

Name: Sand Rush
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.

Name: Chlorophyll
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

Name: Swift Swim
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

Name: Slush Rush
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in snow.

Name: Tangled Feet
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness if it is confused.

Name: Sand Veil
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

Name: Snow Cloak
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in snow.

Name: Beast Boost
Description: Boosts the Pokémon's most proficient stat every time it knocks out a target.

Name: Minus
Description: Boosts the Attack and Special Attack stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus Ability is also in battle.

Name: Plus
Description: Boosts the Attack and Special Attack stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Minus Ability is also in battle.

Name: Quick Feet
Description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.

Name: Unburden
Description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

Name: Victory Star
Description: Boosts the accuracy of the Pokémon and its allies.

Name: Sharpshooter
Description: Boosts the critical-hit ratios of the Pokémon's moves and attacks. Increases critical-hit rate by 1 stage.

Name: Sand Force
Description: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.

Name: Analytic
Description: Boosts the power of the Pokémon's move if it is the last to act that turn.

Name: Levitate
Description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

Name: Stench
Description: By releasing a stench when attacking, the Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

Name: Grand Finale
Description: Can use multiple Finishers. If a teammate uses a Finisher; it becomes an Alliance

Name: Power Construct
Description: Cells gather to aid the Pokémon when its HP drops to half or less, causing it to change into its Complete Forme.

Name: Zen Mode
Description: Changes the Pokémon's shape when its HP drops to half or less.

Name: RKS System
Description: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the memory disc it holds.

Name: Multitype
Description: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the plate it holds.

Name: Protean
Description: Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use. This works only once each time the Pokémon enters battle.

Name: Mummy
Description: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker's Ability to Mummy.

Name: Gooey
Description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

Name: Tangling Hair
Description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

Name: Flame Body
Description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

Name: Effect Spore
Description: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on the attacker.

Name: Poison Point
Description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

Name: Hydration
Description: Cures the Pokémon's status conditions in rain.

Name: Bad Dreams
Description: Damages opposing Pokémon that are asleep.

Name: Aftermath
Description: Damages the attacker if it knocks out the Pokémon with a move that makes direct contact.

Name: Divided They Fall
Description: Disables all foes's Form Changes.

Name: Yin
Description: Doubles nearby Reshiram's Speed

Name: Yang
Description: Doubles nearby Zekrom's Speed

Name: Huge Power
Description: Doubles the Pokémon's Attack stat.

Name: Surge Surfer
Description: Doubles the Pokémon's Speed stat on Electric Terrain.

Name: Heavy Metal
Description: Doubles the Pokémon's weight.

Name: Stakeout
Description: Doubles the damage dealt to a target that has just switched into battle.

Name: Simple
Description: Doubles the effects of the Pokémon's stat changes.

Name: Truant
Description: Each time the Pokémon uses a move, it spends the next turn loafing around.

Name: Air Lock
Description: Eliminates the effects of weather.

Name: Cloud Nine
Description: Eliminates the effects of weather.

Name: Run Away
Description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

Name: Moody
Description: Every turn, one of the Pokémon's stats will be boosted sharply but another stat will be lowered.

Name: Bon Appetit!
Description: Fills the room with food items if a teammate is starving

Name: Slow Start
Description: For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.

Name: Gale Wings
Description: Gives priority to the Pokémon's Flying-type moves while its HP is full.

Name: Triage
Description: Gives priority to the Pokémon's healing moves.

Name: Prankster
Description: Gives priority to the Pokémon's status moves.

Name: Defeatist
Description: Halves the Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP drops to half or less.

Name: Light Metal
Description: Halves the Pokémon's weight.

Name: Fur Coat
Description: Halves the damage from physical moves.

Name: Fluffy
Description: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

Name: Battle Armor
Description: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

Name: Bodyguard
Description: If a team member next to this Pokémon is in trouble and has low HP, and the user has full HP, the Pokémon will step in to take attacks aimed at the friend. Works for allies below 25% HP when an attack is used. Only works against single-target attacks. If an ally falls below 25% HP during a move with multiple hits, a Pokémon with Bodyguard will take the remaining attacks..

Name: Retaliating
Description: If a teammate faints, the Pokemon's Attack, Special Attack, Accuracy, and Evasion are boosted by 1 stage.

Name: Warmth
Description: If a teammate with maxed out Connection is nearby, the Pokemon's Belly does not deplete.

Name: Holding Tears
Description: If a teammate's connection faints; they get an extra Finisher.

Name: Shared Happiness
Description: If a teammate's status condition is healed; it also heals the same condition to the entire team.

Name: Trap Avoider
Description: If a trap is visible, the Pokemon will be immune. Does not work on traps that are still invisible.

Name: Squeeze Out
Description: If all moves have 0 PP and the user lands a regular attack, it squeezes an extra PP to a random move.

Name: Strike Back
Description: If anyone in the team is attacked from behind; the foe's AT and SA is lowered.

Name: Flash Fire
Description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.

Name: Water Absorb
Description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

Name: Volt Absorb
Description: If hit by an Electric-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

Name: Poison Heal
Description: If poisoned, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.

Name: Nontraitor
Description: If the Pokémon has a Confused status or a Cowering status, its wildly aimed attack will not hit friends. Also applies during Blinker status. Turning this skill off allows a Pokémon to target its teammates with certain beneficial moves like Role Play and Sketch when affected by these status conditions.

Name: Defiant
Description: If the Pokémon has any stat lowered by an opposing Pokémon, its Attack stat will be boosted sharply.

Name: Synchronize
Description: If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.

Name: Gluttony
Description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

Name: Trap Seer
Description: If the Pokémon is on an undiscovered trap, upon taking a step it will make the trap visible without setting it off. Stepping on an exposed trap will still have an effect, however. In combination with Trap Avoider, the danger of traps practically disappears.

Name: Wary Fighter
Description: If the Pokémon misses a move, it dashes backwards to distance itself from its target. Also applies to self-targeting moves like Protect, but not to line-of-sight moves. Triggers upon at least one miss. Absorbed/nullified moves count as a miss. Immediately ends status effects which prohibit travel. Pokémon that step into tiles they cannot normally enter (such as water or lava) will warp randomly.

Name: Clutch Performer
Description: If the Pokémon's HP gets dangerously low, its evasiveness is boosted by 3 levels. Activates below 10% HP. No Guard's effect prevents this skill from working, even for the user.

Name: Sniper
Description: If the Pokémon's attack lands a critical hit, the attack is powered up even further.

Name: Fallout
Description: If the user's HP is below 10%, all moves cause Badly Poisoned.

Name: Army Of Two
Description: If there's only one teammate; that teammate gets a big stat boost.

Name: Steamroll
Description: Ignores types and abilities lowering a move's damage.

Name: Fast Friend
Description: Improves the chances that defeated enemies will want to join the team. Boosts recruitment chance by 5%.

Name: Solar Power
Description: In harsh sunlight, the Pokémon's Sp. Atk stat is boosted, but its HP decreases every turn.

Name: Rapid Bullseye
Description: Increases accuracy by 1 stage while using multihit moves.

Name: Guts
Description: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

Name: Wonder Guard
Description: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.

Name: Water Bubble
Description: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves that hit the Pokémon and prevents it from being burned.

Name: Wonder Skin
Description: Makes status moves more likely to miss the Pokémon.

Name: Skill Link
Description: Maximizes the number of times multistrike moves hit.

Name: Harvest
Description: May create another Berry after one is used.

Name: Cursed Body
Description: May disable a move that has dealt damage to the Pokémon.

Name: Poison Touch
Description: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.

Name: Recoil Boost
Description: Moves that recoil do 2X damage. The recoil will also be doubled, so be careful!

Name: Galvanize
Description: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Name: Pixilate
Description: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Name: Aerilate
Description: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Name: Refrigerate
Description: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Name: Mugenono
Description: Nullifies Mugen Genes

Name: Disguise
Description: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.

Name: Way Of The Dragon
Description: Only activates when a Human; or EXHuman; defeats Codd. Revives with Full HP; all hits cause Paralysis; AC and EV are maxed out.

Name: Pierce Hurler
Description: Pokémon's thrown items pierce through walls and other Pokémon without stopping, but impact all Pokémon they hit along the way. Thrown items may still miss, unless the leader throws an item while holding Lockon Specs.

Name: Swarm
Description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

Name: Blaze
Description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

Name: Overgrow
Description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

Name: Steelworker
Description: Powers up Steel-type moves.

Name: Torrent
Description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

Name: Battery
Description: Powers up ally Pokémon's special moves.

Name: Adaptability
Description: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.

Name: Reckless
Description: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

Name: Tough Claws
Description: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

Name: Toxic Boost
Description: Powers up physical moves when the Pokémon is poisoned.

Name: Mega Launcher
Description: Powers up pulse moves.

Name: Iron Fist
Description: Powers up punching moves.

Name: Flare Boost
Description: Powers up special moves when the Pokémon is burned.

Name: Dark Aura
Description: Powers up the Dark-type moves of all Pokémon on the field.

Name: Fairy Aura
Description: Powers up the Fairy-type moves of all Pokémon on the field.

Name: Neuroforce
Description: Powers up the Pokémon's supereffective attacks even further.

Name: Technician
Description: Powers up weak moves so the Pokémon can deal more damage with them.

Name: Magnet Pull
Description: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from fleeing by pulling them in with magnetism.

Name: Arena Trap
Description: Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing from battle.

Name: Clear Body
Description: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

Name: Full Metal Body
Description: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

Name: Leaf Guard
Description: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

Name: Sweet Veil
Description: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep.

Name: Big Pecks
Description: Prevents the Pokémon from having its Defense stat lowered.

Name: Shield Dust
Description: Protective dust shields the Pokémon from the additional effects of moves.

Name: Aroma Veil
Description: Protects the Pokémon and its allies from effects that prevent the use of moves.

Name: Bulletproof
Description: Protects the Pokémon from ball and bomb moves.

Name: Rock Head
Description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

Name: Dimensional Scream
Description: Provides a detailed description of what will happen on the next turn.

Name: Pressure
Description: Puts other Pokémon under pressure, causing them to expend more PP to use their moves.

Name: Serene Grace
Description: Raises the likelihood of additional effects occurring when the Pokémon uses its moves.

Name: Illuminate
Description: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.

Name: Friend Guard
Description: Reduces damage dealt to allies.

Name: Multiscale
Description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

Name: Shadow Shield
Description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

Name: Filter
Description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks that hit the Pokémon.

Name: Prism Armor
Description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks that hit the Pokémon.

Name: Solid Rock
Description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks that hit the Pokémon.

Name: Paradigm Shift
Description: Regular attacks have a 10% chance to become Assist.

Name: Sheer Force
Description: Removes any additional effects from the Pokémon's moves, but increases the moves' power.

Name: Dry Skin
Description: Restores the Pokémon's HP in rain or when it is hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

Name: Contrary
Description: Reverses any stat changes affecting the Pokémon so that attempts to boost its stats instead lower them— and attempts to lower its stats will boost them.

Name: Healer
Description: Sometimes cures the status conditions of the Pokémon's allies.

Name: Liquid Voice
Description: Sound-based moves become Water-type moves.

Name: Soundproof
Description: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

Name: Smiles Go For Miles
Description: Successfully completing all missions on the current dungeon gives the whole team a massive +3 boost on all stats.

Name: Black Glint
Description: Teammates can use Z-Moves multiple times.

Name: Unyelding Bravery
Description: The Pokemon boosts all it's stats by 1 stage when fighting a Legendary or Mythical Pokemon.

Name: Narrow Focus
Description: The Pokemon boosts it's accuracy by 1 stage when inside a corridor.

Name: Funnel Fun
Description: The Pokemon boosts it's evasion by 1 stage when inside a corridor.

Name: Forge A Path
Description: The Pokemon can break down walls using it's regular attack. This lowers the Pokemon's belly by 1.

Name: Evasive Rhythm
Description: The Pokemon dances to dodge multi-hit moves easier. Increases evasion by 1 stage if the foe is using a multihit move.

Name: PP Siphon
Description: The Pokemon has a 10% chance to drain PP from the foe when using a regular attack.

Name: Hand Catching
Description: The Pokemon loves fisticuffs and increases Attack or Special Attack by 1 stage for each time it lands a regular attack. This stack resets after a move is used, a regular attack doesn't land, a turn is skipped, an item is used, or the foe faints.

Name: No U
Description: The Pokemon reflects regular attacks back to the sender. It doesn't affect moves, items, or anything else.

Name: Nutritionist
Description: The Pokemon sometimes restores 1 extra HP, PP or Belly when drinking or eating food.

Name: Quick Dodger
Description: The Pokemon starts each floor with Evasion boosted by 1 stage. It will reset when stepping on a wonder tile though.

Name: All Defying
Description: The Pokemon takes -10% less damage from Legendary or Mythical Pokemon.

Name: Shop Seeking
Description: The Pokemon will detect if shops are present after entering a floor.

Name: Wary Walk
Description: The Pokemon will shiver and freeze in place for 1 turn if it detects a trap nearby.

Name: Stairwind Seeker
Description: The Pokemon will use the wind to detect when a room next to the current one might have stairs.

Name: Power Pitching
Description: The Pokemon's thrown items will travel infinitely until they hit something, instead of falling after 10 tiles.

Name: Telepathy
Description: The Pokémon anticipates and dodges the attacks of its allies.

Name: Early Bird
Description: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

Name: Multitalent
Description: The Pokémon becomes so talented with its moves that it gets slightly more PP to spend on them. Increases maximum PP of all moves by 5.

Name: Aggressor
Description: The Pokémon becomes very aggressive, so its Attack and Special Attack are both boosted by 1 level at the start of a floor. Its Defense and Special Defense are both reduced by 1 level, however.

Name: Defender
Description: The Pokémon becomes very defensive, so its Defense and Special Defense are both boosted by 1 level at the start of a floor. Its Attack and Special Attack are both reduced by 1 level, however.

Name: Haggler
Description: The Pokémon can bargain with Kecleon merchants in dungeons, so it will get lower prices for purchases and higher prices for items it sells. Sell prices are 10% higher, and buy prices are 10% lower.

Name: Scrappy
Description: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves. It is also unaffected by Intimidate.

Name: Corrosion
Description: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type.

Name: Scanner
Description: The Pokémon can see the foe's HP, stats and moves as if they are an ally.

Name: Anticipation
Description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

Name: Tinted Lens
Description: The Pokémon can use "not very effective" moves to deal regular damage.

Name: Klutz
Description: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

Name: Sturdy
Description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

Name: Stance Change
Description: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King's Shield.

Name: Delta Stream
Description: The Pokémon changes the weather so that no moves are supereffective against the Flying type.

Name: Primordial Sea
Description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.

Name: Desolate Land
Description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.

Name: No Charger
Description: The Pokémon charges then unleashes any move that normally requires 2 turns in only one turn. Powering up these charge-up moves so quickly consumes 2 PP, however. When the Pokémon's attack frequency is boosted by Unburden, Swift Swim, or Chlorophyll, the second instant use of an affected move will cost an additional 1 PP, consuming 3 PP total.

Name: Cheerleader
Description: The Pokémon cheers on nearby team members, boosting their Attack and Special Attack by 1 level. Works for adjacent allies. Two adjacent allies will boost each other if both of them have Cheerleader, but a Pokémon adjacent to more than one ally with this skill only receive one boost.

Name: Download
Description: The Pokémon compares an opposing Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.

Name: Power Of Alchemy
Description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

Name: Receiver
Description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

Name: Wimp Out
Description: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP drops to half or less.

Name: Type Advantage Master
Description: The Pokémon critical-hit rate is boosted by 1 stage when attacking enemies that have a type disadvantage.

Name: Damp
Description: The Pokémon dampens its surroundings, preventing all Pokémon from using explosive moves such as Self-Destruct.

Name: Dazzling
Description: The Pokémon dazzles its opponents, making them unable to use priority moves against the Pokémon or its allies.

Name: Lightning Rod
Description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.

Name: Storm Drain
Description: The Pokémon draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.

Name: Elite
Description: The Pokémon earns extra Exp. Points after defeating enemies. Additive 10% bonus to experience gained.

Name: No Guard
Description: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.

Name: Illusion
Description: The Pokémon fools opponents by entering battle disguised as the last Pokémon in its Trainer's party.

Name: All Terrain Hiker
Description: The Pokémon gains the ability to cross water and lava and walk through gulleys. It still can't move through walls.

Name: Absolute Mover
Description: The Pokémon gains the ability to cross water and lava, walk through gulleys, and dig its way through walls.

Name: Super Mobile
Description: The Pokémon gains the ability to walk on water, lava, and clouds. It can also dig its way through walls. Digging through walls with this skill does not increase belly consumption.

Name: Rattled
Description: The Pokémon gets scared when hit by a Dark-, Ghost-, or Bug-type attack or if intimidated, which boosts its Speed stat.

Name: Rain Dish
Description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

Name: Ice Body
Description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in snow.

Name: Item Catcher
Description: The Pokémon has a 50% chance to catch and hold a thrown item. It can't make a catch if it is already holding an item. It also can't catch Seeds and drink items.

Name: Coin Watcher
Description: The Pokémon has a keen eye for money. Increases ₽ generated each floor by 10%.

Name: Regenerator
Description: The Pokémon has a little of its HP restored when withdrawn from battle.

Name: Map Surveyor
Description: The Pokémon is able to sense the layout of the dungeon floor. Does not reveal the location of the stairs.

Name: Comatose
Description: The Pokémon is always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack while in its sleeping state.

Name: Stall
Description: The Pokémon is always the last to use its moves.

Name: Anger Point
Description: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.

Name: Static
Description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

Name: Quick Dodger
Description: The Pokémon is focused on dodging foes's attacks, so its evasion is boosted by 1 level. Its accuracy is reduced by 1 level, however.

Name: Concentrator
Description: The Pokémon is focused on making its attacks hit, so its accuracy is boosted by 1 level. Its evasion is reduced by 1 level, however.

Name: Vital Spirit
Description: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.

Name: Oblivious
Description: The Pokémon is oblivious, keeping it from being infatuated, falling for taunts, or being affected by Intimidate.

Name: Thick Fat
Description: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

Name: White Smoke
Description: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

Name: Super Luck
Description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

Name: Drizzle
Description: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.

Name: Snow Warning
Description: The Pokémon makes it snow when it enters a battle.

Name: Hit and Runner
Description: The Pokémon may avoid a counterstrike that the enemy uses in response to being struck with an attack or move. Ignores counterattacks 33% of the time.

Name: Shed Skin
Description: The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

Name: Honey Gather
Description: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.

Name: Cute Charm
Description: The Pokémon may infatuate attackers that make direct contact with it.

Name: Pickup
Description: The Pokémon may pick up an item another Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

Name: Magic Guard
Description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

Name: Symbiosis
Description: The Pokémon passes its held item to an ally that has used up an item.

Name: Self Curer
Description: The Pokémon recovers faster than usual from status problems. Status conditions last for half as many turns (rounded up).

Name: Wise Healer
Description: The Pokémon recovers more HP than usual if it uses an HP-healing move or item. Increases HP gained from Oran Berries, Sitrus Berries, and moves by 10% (rounded down).

Name: Magic Bounce
Description: The Pokémon reflects status moves instead of getting hit by them.

Name: House Avoider
Description: The Pokémon senses nearby Monster Houses. It will shiver and stop in place for 1 turn when it detects one, 1 tile short of activating it.

Name: Magician
Description: The Pokémon steals the held item from any target it hits with a move.

Name: Pickpocket
Description: The Pokémon steals the held item from attackers that make direct contact with it.

Name: Shadow Tag
Description: The Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon's shadows to prevent them from fleeing or switching out.

Name: Own Tempo
Description: The Pokémon sticks to its own tempo, preventing it from becoming confused or being affected by Intimidate.

Name: Sand Stream
Description: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

Name: Overcoat
Description: The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms. It is also protected from the effects of powders and spores.

Name: Motor Drive
Description: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Electric-type moves. Instead, its Speed stat is boosted.

Name: Sap Sipper
Description: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Grass-type moves. Instead, its Attack stat is boosted.

Name: Imposter
Description: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it's facing.

Name: Forecast
Description: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.

Name: Long Reach
Description: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

Name: Suction Cups
Description: The Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot. This protects it from moves and items that would force it to switch out.

Name: PP Saver
Description: The Pokémon will occasionally use a move without consuming PP. 5% activation rate; ignores Pressure but not No-Charger. Conserves PP for all moves in a linked set.

Name: Energy Saver
Description: The Pokémon's Belly empties slower. Belly lasts about 33% longer.

Name: Survivalist
Description: The Pokémon's Belly fills up more than usual from eating. It may also resist the bad effects of eating Grimy Food. Increases Belly gained by 10% (rounded up). 50% chance to consume Grimy Food with no ill effects.

Name: Weak Armor
Description: The Pokémon's Defense stat is lowered when it takes damage from physical moves, but its Speed stat is sharply boosted.

Name: Cheek Pouch
Description: The Pokémon's HP is restored when it eats any Berry, in addition to the Berry's usual effect.

Name: Speed Boost
Description: The Pokémon's Speed stat is boosted every turn.

Name: Merciless
Description: The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

Name: Erratic Player
Description: The Pokémon's battle performance is erratic, so the positive and negative effects of types influence the power of moves more intensely. This affects the power of moves that the Pokémon uses, as well as the power of moves that hit the Pokémon! Type effectiveness of moves is increased by 50%.

Name: Brick Tough
Description: The Pokémon's body becomes tougher when riled up. Increases max HP by 1% for each stat boost.

Name: Rivalry
Description: The Pokémon's competitive spirit makes it deal more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but less damage to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

Name: Compound Eyes
Description: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.

Name: Steadfast
Description: The Pokémon's determination boosts its Speed stat every time it flinches.

Name: Heatproof
Description: The Pokémon's heatproof body halves the damage taken from Fire-type moves.

Name: Sticky Hold
Description: The Pokémon's held items cling to its sticky body and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

Name: Magma Armor
Description: The Pokémon's hot magma coating prevents it from being frozen.

Name: Immunity
Description: The Pokémon's immune system prevents it from being poisoned.

Name: Insomnia
Description: The Pokémon's insomnia prevents it from falling asleep.

Name: Inner Focus
Description: The Pokémon's intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

Name: Iron Barbs
Description: The Pokémon's iron barbs damage the attacker if it makes direct contact.

Name: Keen Eye
Description: The Pokémon's keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.

Name: Limber
Description: The Pokémon's limber body prevents it from being paralyzed.

Name: Queenly Majesty
Description: The Pokémon's majesty pressures opponents and makes them unable to use priority moves against the Pokémon or its allies.

Name: Marvel Scale
Description: The Pokémon's marvelous scales boost its Defense stat if it has a status condition.

Name: Infiltrator
Description: The Pokémon's moves are unaffected by the target's barriers, substitutes, and the like.

Name: Mold Breaker
Description: The Pokémon's moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

Name: Teravolt
Description: The Pokémon's moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

Name: Turboblaze
Description: The Pokémon's moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

Name: Quick Healer
Description: The Pokémon's natural HP-recovery speed is boosted. Natural HP recovery speed is doubled. Gives the same benefit as the Heal Ribbon.

Name: Hyper Cutter
Description: The Pokémon's prized, mighty pincers prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

Name: Sure Hit Attacker
Description: The Pokémon's regular attacks never miss.

Name: Rough Skin
Description: The Pokémon's rough skin damages attackers that make direct contact with it.

Name: Natural Cure
Description: The Pokémon's status conditions are cured when it switches out.

Name: Strong Jaw
Description: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

Name: Power Pitcher
Description: The Pokémon's throwing power is boosted, so thrown or hurled items inflict greater damage. Increases throwing damage dealt by 50%.

Name: Gap Prober
Description: The Pokémon's thrown moves and items pass through allies to hit foes.

Name: Color Change
Description: The Pokémon's type becomes the type of the move used on it.

Name: Water Veil
Description: The Pokémon's water veil prevents it from being burned.

Name: Emergency Exit
Description: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP drops to half or less.

Name: Aura Break
Description: The effects of "Aura" Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.

Name: Nature Gifter
Description: The effects of any Seed or Berry that the Pokémon eats spread to the whole party. This IQ Skill only works for the team leader. Does not include Blast Seeds, Dough Seeds, or Reviver and Reviser Seeds when eaten from the Treasure Bag. Seeds and Berries thrown at a leader with this skill are unaffected, even if the leader threw them at a Pokémon holding a Bounce Band or at themselves with a Curve Band.

Name: Tight Formation
Description: The more team members; the lower the damage from wide-ranging moves such as Wide Slash.

Name: Parental Bond
Description: The parent and child attack one after the other.

Name: Link Boost
Description: The power of linked moves is boosted by 10%.

Name: Extra Striker
Description: The regular attack has a 10% chance to hit twice.

Name: Liquid Ooze
Description: The strong stench of the Pokémon's oozed liquid damages attackers that use HP-draining moves.

Name: Long Range Rescue
Description: The team can rescue a Pokemon just by being in the same room.

Name: Sneaky
Description: The user does not wake up sleeping wild Pokemon by walking right next to them.

Name: Harem
Description: The user's team is immune to Infatuation and Charm from foes

Name: Taiyou
Description: The whole team is immune to Curse; Grudge; and Perish Song.

Name: Food Finder
Description: Tiny Apples spawn twice as often.

Name: Electric Surge
Description: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Grassy Surge
Description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Misty Surge
Description: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Psychic Surge
Description: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Drought
Description: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Name: Unnerve
Description: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

Name: Pure Power
Description: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.

Name: Second Chance
Description: When a move misses, the Pokemon's Accuracy is boosted by 1 stage for only the next turn.

Name: Not Quite My Tempo
Description: When afflicted by a status condition, one random stat is boosted by 1 stage.

Name: Collector
Description: When an enemy is defeated by the user (not teammates), the chances that it will leave a treasure box behind are doubled.

Name: Unaware
Description: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target's stat changes.

Name: Belligerent
Description: When below 10% HP, the Pokemon's moves do twice as much damage, but it cannot use any items.

Name: Regik
Description: When entering a new floor, Regik is substituted with a completely random ability.

Name: Frisk
Description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

Name: Forewarn
Description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.

Name: Trace
Description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.

Name: Schooling
Description: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.

Name: Deep Breather
Description: When it reaches a new floor, the Pokémon breathes deeply. 1 PP is restored per floor. This affects a random move among those that do not have full PP.

Name: Acute Sniffer
Description: When it reaches a new floor, the Pokémon knows the number of items that are lying on the ground. This number includes buried items, which are normally inaccessible.

Name: Stair Sensor
Description: When it reaches a new floor, the Pokémon uses its intuition to know where the floor's stairway is. Points towards one of eight directions.

Name: Shields Down
Description: When its HP drops to half or less, the Pokémon's shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.

Name: Counter Basher
Description: When taking damage, the Pokemon has a 1% chance to activate the Counter status.

Name: Counter Hitter
Description: When taking damage, the Pokemon has a 5% chance to activate the Mini Counter status.

Name: Prevention
Description: When the Pokemon has a status conditions, it's teammates will be immune to the same status condition until it heals.

Name: Lonely Courage
Description: When the Pokemon has no nearby teammates, all it's stats are boosted by 1 stage.

Name: Intimidate
Description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

Name: Practice Swinger
Description: When the Pokémon fails to hit the target with an attack or move, its Attack and Special Attack get boosted for only the next turn. Attack and Special Attack are boosted until the Pokémon successfully deals damage or the next turn ends (whichever occurs first). In the case of multi-target moves or multi-strike moves, the boost only applies to a single hit.

Name: Justified
Description: When the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type attack, its Attack stat is boosted by its sense of justice.

Name: Innards Out
Description: When the Pokémon is knocked out, it damages its attacker by the amount equal to the HP it had left before it was hit.

Name: Moxie
Description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it shows moxie, which boosts its Attack stat.

Name: Battle Bond
Description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, its bond with its Trainer is strengthened, and its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats are boosted.

Name: Dancer
Description: Whenever a dance move is used in battle, the Pokémon will copy the user to immediately perform that dance move itself.

Name: Mind Over Matter
Description: Wonder tiles will heal all status conditions.
